channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Russian forces take Ukrainian villagers across border, media says
item.description: Russian forces have crossed the border with Ukraine in the northeastern Sumy region and taken about 50 residents of a Ukrainian border village into Russia, Ukrainian media quoted the military as saying on Sunday. Ukraine's public broadcaster Suspilne and the Ukrainska Pravda news outlet said Russi

item.title: Trump set to expand immigration crackdown in 2026 amid backlash
item.description: US President Donald Trump is preparing for a more aggressive immigration crackdown in 2026 with billions in new funding, including by raiding more workplaces — even as backlash builds ahead of next year’s midterm elections. Trump has already surged immigration agents into major US citi

item.title: Ukraine welcomes €90bn EU loan, despite lack of deal on Russian assets
item.description: Ukraine thanked the European Union on Friday for deciding to provide it with 90 billion euros ($105.46 billion) of support over the next two years - even if the bloc failed to agree on an ambitious plan to finance it using frozen Russian assets. Russian President Vladimir Putin said the EU had bac

item.title: Putin sticks to Russian demands on Ukraine, says EU 'robbery' failed
item.description: President Vladimir Putin offered no compromise on Friday on his terms for ending the war in Ukraine and accused the European Union of attempting "daylight robbery" of Russian assets. As US President Donald Trump seeks an end to Europe's deadliest conflict since World War Two, Putin said the onus w

item.title: Lebanon-Israel truce committee talks widen
item.description: The committee overseeing the Hezbollah-Israel truce in Lebanon focused on Friday on how to return displaced people to their homes, addressing civilian issues to help prevent renewed war if a year-end deadline to disarm Hezbollah is not met. The 15th meeting of the committee reflected a long-standi

item.title: Ukraine clinches deal to restructure $2.6 billion in 'toxic' GDP warrants
item.description: Ukraine clinched a long-awaited deal to restructure $2.6 billion of growth-linked debt on Thursday, with creditors overwhelmingly accepting a bonds-and-cash swap offer - a key step for the country to emerge from sovereign default. Kyiv said holders of 99 per cent of the so-called GDP warrants had

item.title: UK welcomes EU funding agreement for Ukraine
item.description: British finance minister Rachel Reeves on Friday welcomed a decision by European Union leaders to loan 90 billion euros ($105 billion) to Ukraine to fund its defence against Russia. "I am pleased to see the agreement made today at the European Council to provide vital financial support for Ukraine

item.title: Italy raids illegal tobacco factory, seizes 27 tonnes of cigarettes
item.description: An illegal tobacco factory that produced four million counterfeit cigarettes per day, evading millions of euros in taxes and duties, has been uncovered and seized near Rome, Italian and European Union authorities said on Thursday. The site in Pomezia, around 30 kilometres (19 miles) south of Rome,

item.title: Albanian parliament erupts over corruption allegations against deputy PM
item.description: Opposition lawmakers scuffled with police inside the Albanian parliament on Thursday, following weeks of tensions over corruption allegations against the deputy of Prime Minister Edi Rama and other officials. Lawmakers lit flares, threw water at the speaker and occupied seats reserved for governme

item.title: Russia hopes Trump does not make a 'fatal mistake' on Venezuela
item.description: Russia's Foreign Ministry said on Thursday it hoped that US President Donald Trump's administration would not make a fatal mistake over Venezuela and said Moscow was concerned about US decisions that threatened international shipping. Trump on Tuesday ordered a "blockade" of all sanctioned oil tan

item.title: EU to lift sanctions on Kosovo and release financial aid, von der Leyen says
item.description: The European Union is set to lift sanctions it imposed on Kosovo in 2023 over tensions in the north of the country and will release financial assistance, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said. EU countries introduced punitive measures against ethnic Albanian-majority Kosovo after

item.title: UK police plan tougher action against antisemitic chants and protests
item.description: British police on Wednesday said they would take tougher action against people who use placards and chants to target the Jewish community, saying recent violent incidents had changed the context around such protests. The move comes days after 15 people died in a mass shooting at Australia's Bondi

item.title: US pursuing third oil tanker near Venezuela, officials say
item.description: The US Coast Guard is pursuing an oil tanker in international waters near Venezuela, officials told Reuters on Sunday, in what would be the second such operation this weekend and the third in less than a week if successful. “The United States Guard is in active pursuit of a sanctioned dark f

item.title: US intelligence indicates Putin's war aims in Ukraine are unchanged
item.description: US intelligence reports continue to warn that Russian President Vladimir Putin has not abandoned his aims of capturing all of Ukraine and reclaiming parts of Europe that belonged to the former Soviet empire, six sources familiar with US intelligence said, even as negotiators seek an end to the war

item.title: Australian Prime Minister booed as Bondi Beach attack victims honoured
item.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese was booed by an angry crowd gathered at the famous Bondi beach on Sunday to honour the victims of a gun attack a week earlier that targeted a seaside Jewish Hanukkah festival event. The nation marked a day of reflection on Sunday to honour the 15 people k

item.title: Long lines at the food pantry: Inflation tests Trump’s base in Michigan
item.description: On a recent snowy morning in a Trump-loving part of rural Michigan, three dozen cars idled outside a firehouse-turned-food pantry. Inside, volunteers packaged lettuce, apples and other household staples that have surged or stayed high in price this year. Taylor Ludwig, a 35-year-old mother of thre

item.title: Republican critics fear incomplete disclosure of Epstein files will loom over midterms
Brazil's Lula warns US intervention in Venezuela could be catastrophic
Chilean investors cheer election of Kast as president
Canadian housing starts increase 9.4 per cent in November
School bus accident in Colombia kills 17, injures 20
US preparing to seize more tankers off Venezuela's coast
Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing appears in court, judge mulls media access
Nobel Peace Prize winner Machado vows to bring award back to Venezuela
Trump says to make phone call to stop Thai-Cambodia fighting
Student killed in Kentucky university shooting
Trump unveils $12b aid package for farmers hit by trade war
US Justice Department accuses two Chinese men of trying to smuggle Nvidia chips
Australia promises new hate laws as youngest Bondi Beach shooting victim is laid to rest
item.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese on Thursday promised a crackdown on hate speech in the wake of an attack on a Jewish holiday event at Sydney's Bondi Beach, as the youngest of 15 victims was laid to rest. Yellow toy bees topped the coffin of 10-year-old Matilda, who was remembered as a '

item.title: Saudi Arabia lifts expatriate fees to boost industrial sector
item.description: Saudi Arabia has abolished the “expatriate fees” imposed on foreign workers employed in industrial establishments registered under industrial licences. The decision was taken at a cabinet meeting chaired by the crown prince and Prime Minister Mohammed bin Salman, following a recommenda

item.title: China says Philippines distorted facts about incident near disputed atoll
item.description: China's defence ministry accused the Philippines on Wednesday of distorting the facts about an incident involving the Chinese coastguard and Filipino fishermen near a South China Sea shoal. Manila's coastguard said over the weekend that three Filipino fishermen were injured and two fishing vessels

item.title: Thailand works to repatriate thousands stranded at Cambodia border crossing
item.description: Thailand is working out how to repatriate up to 6,000 citizens unable to return home through a major border crossing in Cambodia closed as fighting along the contested border extended into a second week, authorities said on Tuesday. The militaries of the Southeast Asian neighbours are clashing at

item.title: Malaysian PM Anwar names new ministers in cabinet reshuffle
item.description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim named new trade and economic ministers on Tuesday, reshuffling his cabinet in a bid to stabilise his administration and fill several vacancies arising from resignations and expired senate terms. The Southeast Asian nation has enjoyed steady economic growth an

item.title: ‘For all I know, she could be dead’ says son of Myanmar’s Suu Kyi
item.description: With her health failing and an information vacuum around Myanmar's detained former leader Aung San Suu Kyi, her son worries that he may not even know if she passed away. Kim Aris told Reuters he has not heard from his 80-year-old mother in years, and has received only sporadic, secondhand details

item.title: 'Hero' who disarmed Bondi gunman recovers in hospital as donations pour in
item.description: Donations for a Sydney man who wrestled a gun from one of the alleged attackers during a mass shooting at Bondi Beach have surged past A$1.1 million ($744,000), as he recovers in hospital after surgery for bullet wounds. Forty-three-year-old Ahmed al Ahmed, a Muslim father-of-two, hid behind parke

item.title: Hong Kong's legal clampdown on Jimmy Lai, tycoon and China critic
item.description: Hong Kong media tycoon and pro-democracy activist Jimmy Lai was found guilty on Monday in his landmark security trial on charges of conspiracy to collude with foreign forces and sedition, which could mean life in prison. The 78-year-old Lai, founder of the pro-democracy Apple Daily newspaper who h

item.title: Thailand vows to keep fighting Cambodia
item.description: Thailand's leader vowed on Saturday to keep fighting on the disputed border with Cambodia as fighter jets struck targets hours after US President Donald Trump said he had brokered a new ceasefire. Caretaker Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul said the Southeast Asian nation would "continue to

item.title: IndiGo estimates over $55 million payout to customers following flight cancellations
item.description: India's IndiGo on Friday estimated a payout of more than 5 billion rupees ($55.19 million) in total to customers impacted by the carrier's mass cancellations last week. The airline had scrapped around 4,500 flights last week because of poor pilot roster planning, leaving tens of thousands of passe

item.title: ADB approves 100m USD loan to boost financial access for women entrepreneurs in India
item.description: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) on Friday said it has signed a 100-million-U.S.-dollar loan agreement with Five-Star Business Finance Limited (FBFL) to expand access to micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) business loans for women borrowers from lower-income groups in India. T

item.title: Thai PM moves to dissolve parliament
item.description: Thailand's Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul announced on Thursday that he is "returning power to the people," moving to dissolve parliament and clear the way for elections earlier than previously anticipated. Government spokesperson Siripong Angkasakulkiat told Reuters the move followed a disagr
